Declaration (声明)

char gender = 'M';


  • Introduce a variable called gender into your program.
  • You can use gender later in your program.
  • The type of gender is char (character).
  • gender is initialized (初始化) to the character M.
  • You can assign (赋值) other values to gender.
  • gender refers to a location (object) in memory.

Definition (定义)


char gender = 'M'; is also a definition.


Any definitions are declarations.

All declarations are definitions (at least for now).

Identifiers (标识符)


char gender = 'M';


the name gender is an identifier.


  • made up of letters, numbers, and underscores
  • do not start with a number

Data Types


int   double


int $\approx \mathbb{Z}$   double $\approx \mathbb{R}$


$100 \in $ int   $-100 \in $ int


$3.14159 \in $ double   $6.022e23 \in $ double

Data Types: int

INT_MIN = -2147483647 INT_MAX = 2147483648

Data Types

$a \in $ int   $b \in $ int


$a + b \in $ int

$a - b \in $ int

$a \times b \in $ int

$a \;/\; b \in $ int

$a \;\%\; b \in $ int (取余)

Data Types



The type of a variable determines

  • the set of values it can have and
  • what operations can be performed on it.

Data Types: char


printf


int printf(const char *format, ...);

  • format: format string (格式串)
  • ...: 可变长参数列表

printf


int printf(const char *format, ...);

The format string consists of

  • $\ge 0$ ordinary characters (not $\%$)
  • $\ge 0$ conversion specifications (转换说明), each of which is introduced by $\%$

printf

int printf(const char *format, ...);

Escape sequence (转义序列)

  • \n: Newline
  • \t: Horizontal Tab
  • \": Double quotation mark
  • \': Single quotation mark
  • \\: Backslash
  • \b: Backspace
  • \a: Alert
